meanings.definition: The outermost of the three primary germ layers in a developing embryo, giving rise to the epidermis and nervous system.
meanings.sent1: During embryonic development, the ectoderm forms the outer layer of the skin.
meanings.sent2: The ectoderm is responsible for the formation of the brain and spinal cord.
meanings.sent3: The ectoderm must be feeling proud, creating both skin and nerves!
meanings.sent4: Just like a painter creating a masterpiece, the ectoderm meticulously crafts the nervous system.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the ectoderm as a skilled architect, designing the intricate network of nerves in the body.

meanings.definition: The outer layer of cells in a blastula, giving rise to the epidermis and nervous system.
meanings.sent1: In the blastula, the ectoderm forms the outermost layer of cells.
meanings.sent2: The ectoderm plays a crucial role in the development of the skin and nervous tissues.
meanings.sent3: The ectoderm in the blastula is like the first brushstroke on a blank canvas.
meanings.sent4: As the blastula grows, the ectoderm unfolds like a delicate flower blooming.
meanings.sent5: Picture the ectoderm as a tiny seed that sprouts into the protective skin and intricate nerves.
